comments.body: Maybe `r-base >=3.3.2,<3.3.3` (or `r-base ==3.3.2` if that works) to avoid bloating the matrix when another version of r-base is added? What do you think?

This would mean that we would need to adjust this to point to the latest version with any new R release. Wasn't there an option in conda-build-all to only use the last *n* versions that satisfy the constraints?

> This would mean that we would need to adjust this to point to the latest version with any new R release.

Yes. Different from python build strings, the r-base build strings seems to be up to micro. For example:
```
conda search -c r r-oce
r-oce                        0.9_18                 r3.3.1_0  r               
                          .  0.9_20                 r3.3.2_0  r 
```

> Wasn't there an option in conda-build-all to only use the last *n* versions that satisfy the constraints?

`conda-build-all` will do *n* version. I am worried about that when I mentioned the CI strain above.
I know, but can't *n* be simply set to 1 or a reasonably small number?
Not sure. But I like the explicitness of having that in the `conda-build-all` call like what you did above.
Sure, I'm fine to contrain the `n` as well in the call above. What would be a reasonable number, 2?
I have just checked and n=2 is already the default. If you want, I can add that explicitly.

No, that is fine. Thanks!

Do you think this is ready to go? Or do you want to make some more modifications?

I think we need the same constraint in `conda-smithy`.

ref: https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/fe04e79d79ff6ae7d6e5b899283c7106b268759e/conda_smithy/configure_feedstock.py#L566

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@
# We just want to build all of the recipes.
conda-build-all ./recipes --matrix-condition "numpy >=1.11" "python >=2.7,<3|>=3.5" "r-base >=3.3.2"

@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@echo ""
echo "Removing homebrew from Travis CI to avoid conflicts."
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/uninstall > ~/uninstall_homebrew.sh
chmod +x ~/uninstall_homebrew.sh
~/uninstall_homebrew.sh -fq

@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@export CONDA_NPY=19
# Needed because conda-build-all does not set CONDA_R due to a bug (see SciTools/conda-build-all#73).
export CONDA_R=3.3.2

# Remove homebrew.

comments.body:
To be clear, I'm totally ok with these changes for now. We may need to hack something in the feedstock as well. I'd prefer though if we can add this in a separate PR to staged-recipes so it is easier to track and remove once it is fixed. Also feel free to rebase this on said separate PR so it is ready to go and using the same commit.

Note: When no recipes are in a PR, the linter complains. It is easy to silent the linter by adding `[skip lint]` to the commit message.

xref: https://github.com/SciTools/conda-build-all/pull/74
Thanks @jakirkham. I'll do that once I am back from vacation next wednesday. After that, I hope that I'll be able to speed up the porting of the R channel.
The PR now also does not contain the workaround anymore, because I think the conda-build-all changes have been merged and released, right?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@
# We just want to build all of the recipes.
conda-build-all ./recipes --matrix-condition "numpy >=1.11" "python >=2.7,<3|>=3.5" "r-base >=3.3.2"

comments.body: Surely the `conda info --root` is superfluous - conda is already on the PATH, so it should just find it...?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@    conda install --yes --quiet conda-build-all
    conda install --yes --quiet conda-forge-build-setup
    source "`conda info --root`/bin/run_conda_forge_build_setup"

    # We don't need to build the example recipe.

comments.body:
You can add right below here:

`conda install --yes conda-build  1.21.7`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@
    # We don't need to build the example recipe.
    rm -rf ./recipes/example

    # revert conda-build to 1.21.7, to get ObsPy 1.0.2 built, see conda-forge/staged-recipes#582
